suppress.notes: Sudo Platform DI Relay Sample App (nor dependencies) do not use the loadXML() function.
file name: aws-android-sdk-appsync-api-3.3.2.jar Related to file path traversal.
file name: aws-android-sdk-appsync-runtime-3.3.2.jar Related to file path traversal.
Guava temporary file creation is not used in the Sudo Decentralized Identity Relay Sample App.
file name: legacy-support-core-utils-1.0.0.aar Not applicable to this example app

file name: okio-jvm-3.2.0.jar description: GzipSource does not handle an exception that might be raised when parsing a malformed gzip buffer. This may lead to denial of service of the Okio client when handling a crafted GZIP archive, by using the GzipSource class. reason for suppression: DoS attack from unzipping a malformed gzip data stream. The affected component is Okio which is only used by the AWS SDK. We will only be using this SDK to download data from trusted sources.

file name: okio-metadata-3.2.0-all.jar description: GzipSource does not handle an exception that might be raised when parsing a malformed gzip buffer. This may lead to denial of service of the Okio client when handling a crafted GZIP archive, by using the GzipSource class. reason for suppression: DoS attack from unzipping a malformed gzip data stream. The affected component is Okio which is only used by the AWS SDK. We will only be using this SDK to download data from trusted sources.

file name: guava-31.1-jre.jar description: Use of Java's default temporary directory for file creation in `FileBackedOutputStream` in Google Guava versions 1.0 to 31.1 on Unix systems and Android Ice Cream Sandwich allows other users and apps on the machine with access to the default Java temporary directory to be able to access the files created by the class. reason for suppression: This is a sample app (not a real production app), so this vulnerability should not cause issues.
